stanza.line: In the old age black was not counted fairfair
Or if it were it bore not beauty namename
But now is black beauty successive heirheir
And beauty slandered with a bastard shameshame
For since each hand hath put on nature powerpower
Fairing the foul with art false borrowed faceface
Sweet beauty hath no name no holy bowerbower
But is profaned if not lives in disgracedisgrace
Therefore my mistress eyes are raven blackblack
Her eyes so suited and they mourners seemseem
At such who not born fair no beauty lacklack
Slandering creation with a false esteemesteem
Yet so they mourn becoming of their woewoe
That every tongue says beauty should look soso
